definition: home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
variant of 眷[juan4]/to care about/to look fondly on

sentences.english: Had it not been for his family, He'd have gone away long ago .
sentences.chinese: 要是没有家眷拖累，他早就远走高飞了。

sentences.english: JiXin received old classmate party invitation, the condition is necessary to bring dependents.
sentences.chinese: 齐欣接到老同窗聚会的约请，条件是必需要带家眷。

sentences.english: The Japanese occupation of Hong Kong, master Wan Jinhong with dependents back to macau.
sentences.chinese: 日军占领香港，少爷万锦洪携家眷回到澳门。

sentences.english: If there was a way to have my family with me, I'd spend my life here.
sentences.chinese: 假若有办法把家眷带来，我宁可在这里过一辈子。

sentences.english: Last week he brought his family over from the United States.
sentences.chinese: 上周他把家眷从美国迁来。

sentences.english: She had no family. She was thirty-six.

definition: relatives/members of the same family, clan, tribe etc
(old) servant hired to keep guard, run errands etc
wives and concubines (of a polygamous man)/harem
to send under escort/to transport a detainee
imperial clan/member of the imperial clan/clansman/ancestral shrine
to guard/to protect/bodyguard (for officials in ancient times)
